name: Men's Untapped Tee - Bottle Cap - Venetian Grey
description: To order, select the size you want and click the "ADD TO CART" button below. Status: Limited Sizes Available. We will let you know ASAP if the size you ordered is not available. Or, feel free to e-mail info@spune.com for availability ahead of time. Thanks for your cooperation! Availability: Men's Sizes Available: S, M, XL Select the size you prefer below and click "Add To Cart". USA Shipping: International shipping: E-mail info@spune.com if you’re interested. - Tri - Blend Jersey - 50% Polyester 25% Cotton 25% Rayon. - Pre-shrunk, Extremely soft, comfortable, and stretchy. Untapped was designed by its organizers as an event equally focused on quality music and beer, a balance uncommon at music festivals and rarely found at beer events. The aim is not about the quantity of selection but rather the curating of the best in both craft beer and emerging local and national bands. A few of our favorite things so to speak! The addition of local artisans, quality food vendors, and unique locations add texture to each event and create a vibrant village of activity. What started as a self-serving shindig designed to showcase our personal interests turned out to be something that resonates in a way that is meaningful to us and our supporters!

name: Air Review: Low Wishes - CD
description:
Stream Songs Here
To order CD, click "ADD TO CART" below Release: SP015 | 01.29.13 Status: In Stock. Description: This is co-release with our friends at Velvet Blue Music. Air Review started writing songs in 2008 out of the converted garage of an unassuming suburban house outside of Dallas, Texas. Meeting once a week for nearly a year in a room without air conditioning or heating, the quintet carefully crafted a record that they later self-released in 2009. After a couple years of playing countless shows and receiving glowing reviews, the band still felt like something was missing. The group hibernated for another 12 months and re-invented themselves. The first offering from their newly defined sound, America's Son, became one of the most requested songs on north Texas' 91.7 KXT who later included it in their "Best Songs of 2011" right next to Adele, Foster the People and Coldplay. America's Son also caught the attention of The Huffington Post and CMJ who claimed it was "a very different sound from other folk-pop groups and considered the band one to watch in 2012". Air Review's dynamic live shows have landed them support slots for acts such as Flaming Lips, Portugal. The Man, Grimes and School of Seven Bells. Their knack for engaging melodies has turned heads around the world securing licensing with the International Olympic Committee and Levi's. All of this paved the way for their upcoming masterfully composed full-length album, Low Wishes, to be released by Velvet Blue Music (Huntington Beach, CA) and Spune (DFW, Texas) January 29th, 2013. This self-produced and recorded, pop infused indie record gracefully combines folk influences with synthesizers, beats and noisy guitars. It is soft and subtle at times, yet unmistakably anthemic, complete with magnificent choruses. Low Wishes is a nostalgic look at growing into adulthood and an affirmation of the belief that there is something more to life. Without hesitation, Air Review is clearly poised to stand out in a big way in 2013, simply by staying the course it has already set. - Velvet Blue Music / Spune. _________________________________________ Track Listing: 1. Rebel 2. Young 3. America's Son 4. H 5. Waiting Lessons 6. Low Wishes 7. My Automatic 8. Fin 9. Animal Follow Air Review

name: Datahowler: Crystal Gazers 10" Vinyl
description:
Stream Songs Here
iTunes Download Here
To order vinyl, click "ADD TO CART" below Release: SP014 | 01.15.13 Status: In Stock. Description: Datahowler, born Ross Edman, is a Mad Scientist from Dallas, Texas. A musician, producer, designer and wizard. Most recently Mr. Edman has collaborated with members of The Polyphonic Spree and shared the stage with Dale Earnhardt Jr. Jr., Purity Ring, Die Antwood, Yelle and more. In addition to his musical abilities, Edman has designed art for Mos Def, Ryan Adams and Jimmy Eat World. He also loves to make stuff - especially projection models, terrariums and other magical goods. Hence, Mad Scientist! Abracadabra. This is where Velvet Blue Music (Huntington Beach, CA), Tree Fall Sounds (Dallas, TX), and Spune (DFW, Texas) enter the picture. A collective effort to educate the universe about Datahowler and his gifts. Or, at least assist in pulling the rabbit from the hat. The label trio having already introduced a 7" vinyl series, felt it seemed only natural to include Datahowler. Except this 7" grew to be a 10"! Datahowler's latest release, "The Crystal Gazers" comes in the form of a limited edition 10" colored vinyl / digital EP. It's 5 songs and 20 minutes of Ross' favorite sonic compositions. _________________________________________ Track Listing: 1. Watchtowers 2. Weight Of Dreams (Preface) 3. Crystal Gazers 4. Hidden Kingdowms 5. Tunnel Vision Follow Datahowler

name: Bethan: Bethan Presents Christmas - CD EP
description:
Stream Songs Here
To order CD, click "ADD TO CART" below Release: SP013 | 11.13.11 Status: In Stock. Description: Spune is happy to announce its 13th release and first Christmas album! We have teamed up again with our west coast pals at Velvet Blue Music to share these wonderful tunes. Bethan has given a few Christmas classics their own unique spin. We dig it! Read below to find out how this little holiday gem came about. Happy holidays, everyone! This crazy little Christmas collection started at band practice. We were wrapping up for the night and someone mentioned that it might be fun to arrange and record a few Christmas songs a la Bethan. After a collective glance at our watches we realized we had only a few weeks to do this thing so we set the ball in motion. We had three weeks to arrange, track, mix and deliver, which made the process exciting...and deadline driven. Turns out we all work pretty well under pressure, and we still like each other, to boot! The most fun and challenging aspect of this project was re-imagining songs we've grown up listening to. Inspired by Christmas recordings from Julie Andrews, Doris Day and regularly filling our ears with Tom Waits and David Lynch scores, the result was nothing short of an orchestrated X-periment! An end result that we're extremely happy with. We hope you enjoy it, too! -- Bethan _________________________________________ Track Listing: 1. Let All Mortal Flesh Keep Silence 2. O Come, O Come Emmanuel 3. O Holy Night 4. In The Bleak Midwinter 5. Silent Night Follow Bethan

name: Doug Burr: Trembling Lips and Pale Fingertips 7"
description: To pre-order 7", click "ADD TO CART" below Listen Release: SP011 | 03.06.12 Status: In Stock! Description: This record is a co-release with our friends at Vevet Blue Music and Tree Fall Sounds. Trembling Lips and Pale Fingertips (out on 3/06) is the newest offering from Doug Burr featuring alternate versions of songs from his critically acclaimed record, O Ye Devastator. It will be released digitally and as a limited edition 7" with 2 tracks on the vinyl and a 4-track download card. The tracks are beautifully stripped down isolating Doug's distinct vocals and allowing his lyrics to be front and center. For those who are unfamiliar with Doug Burr, he is a Denton, TX local troubadour . . .a folk hero! After 4 full lengths (O Ye Devastator, The Shawl, On Promenade, The Sickle and The Sheaves), Burr has carved his path in music. It’s hard to generalize Burr’s music…call it folk, roots, Americana, twang, folk pop, call it whatever you like. Nobody leaves a Burr performance unaffected, whether it’s Mr. Burr alone or accompanied by a full band. His carefully crafted, heart-felt songs seem to resonate with all who hear them! While Burr has been on stage less recently, he has been busy writing and recording demos of new songs. His songs have also been featured in a handful of indie movies and TV shows. For those who are hungry for more Burr now, we're offering this new 7"! Burr's music means different things to different people yet there’s always an underlying personal connection to all who listen! Below are a few quotes from what others are saying. Thanks for listening! "This man sings with such an ease it will leave you planted right where you are with a sensation to do nothing but listen. And listen close." - Fensepost "One of the most criminally overlooked performers working in the state." - Fort Worth Star-Telegram "Exquisitely detailed, slow and deliberate"- Paste Magazine "Burr evokes distinctive voices such as Wilco's Jeff Tweedy or Red House Painters' Mark Kozelek. These warm, inviting compositions are effortlessly beautiful."- Fort Worth Weekly "Burr shares an intrinsic knowledge of song dynamics with the likes of Jeff Tweedy, and has a voice that tugs at the heart strings. Brilliant! " - Americana UK "Exceptional Denton Troubadour" - Austin Sound Follow Doug Burr Track Listing: A Side: "A Black Wave Is Comin'" (Forest Fortress Version) B Side: "Chief of Police in Chicago" (Indefinite Surveillance Version) Download Card comes with 4 tracks: 1. "A Black Wave Is Comin'" (Forest Fortress Version) 2. "Chief of Police in Chicago" (Indefinite Surveillance Version) 3. "Do You Hear Wedding Bells" (Low Down Version) 4. "A Black Wave Is Comin' (taken from the full length album, O Ye Devastator)

name: Gold Beach: Gold Beach - 7"
description: To pre-order 7", click "ADD TO CART" below Release: SP010 | 02.28.12 Status: Will ship 02.22.12 Description: This record is a co-release with our friends at Velvet Blue Music and Tree Fall Sounds. Initially hailing from the Houston area, the principle songwriters of Gold Beach, Tony Daugherty and Michael Winningham, grew up on the same street. The two relocated to Austin and put the band together, which includes a plethora of regional talent, including: Jeremy Gomez (x-Mineral, the Glass Family), Carlos Orozco (x-Western Keys, Black Drum Set), Nicole Kern (x-Balmorhea), Evan Jacobs (Tacks! the Boy Disaster, Polyphonic Spree), Andy Sharp (Girling), and Henna Chou (x-My Education). Since then, the band has been on a roll! They self released their first record which the Austin Chronicle called a "carefully crafted debut", supported national bands such as Memoryhouse, Talkdemonic, Wooden Birds, Balmorhea and recently completed a Daytrotter session. KUT/NPR Austin had the band in studio and Texas Music Matters/NPR included the band in their "Best of 2011" list. Needless to say, the band has been hard at work and already has made plans in the studio with renown producer John Congleton (St. Vincent, the Walkmen, Wye Oak) to start work on the next record. This is where we pick up with the band! Gold Beach "Gold Beach" out 2/28 is the first in a series of 7"s that is being released as a joint effort by Velvet Blue Music, Spune, and Tree Fall Sounds. It's 2 tracks on beautiful white vinyl, which includes a previously unreleased song and a download card with an whopping 6 tracks! We anticipate great things for the band in 2012! Follow Gold Beach Track Listing: Side A - Gold Beach Side B - The Soft Effect Download Card comes with 4 additional tracks: Diving Bell / Habibi / Skin Of Yours / Everyone I Know

name: Seryn: This Is Where We Are - CD
description:
Stream Songs Here
To order CD, click "ADD TO CART" below Release: SP009 | 01.25.11 Status: In Stock. Description: This is co-release with our friends at Velvet Blue Music. Seryn is a 5 piece band who calls Denton, Texas their home. When listening to the well layered textures of guitars, ukulele, accordion, bass, viola, banjo and various percussion, it's hard to imagine This Is Where We Are is the band's debut effort. The band's strength resides in their vast musical talent and understanding of dynamics. Their beauty is gracefully displayed through chilling harmonies. Each member and their voice carry the same importance. One is not complete without the other. It is in this craft that the young band shines so bright. It has earned them a sound that isn't easily defined, but still proven triumphant. What may first appear as straight folk songs, later transcend into menacing walls of sound. The term "Folk-Pop" has been thrown around and maybe it loosely fits, but we will leave the definitions up to you. The Denton Record-Chronicle said "Seryn's set was so dynamic that you could feel the key changes in your feet, through Festival Hall’s concrete floor!". While the Fort Worth Star-Telegram reported, "Watching Seryn perform, it's hard to convince yourself that those crystalline, multi-part harmonies are not pre-recorded or some kind of sleight of ear." You can see where this is going... This is Where We Are was produced by Britton Beisenherz (Ramble Creek), and recorded over the course of a few months. The experience felt at their live show seems to be captured well in these recordings, which was something of great importance to the band. The band has created their own buzz in the most traditional way too by winning people over at their shows. It's not often that a band without a record out is able to play so many great bills and sold out shows. Much less, be nominated for awards such as Best Folk Artist, and Song of the Year (Dallas Observer). There is no shortage of regional press on them either but the band is excited to take their sound, their show, and their new record on the road. They will be traveling all over the US in the coming months. Go see them play and you will be sucked in! Soaring vocal harmonies boil over alongside the rousing rat-a-tat-tats of snare drum, the intensity of the composition climbing steadily upward until one last glorious bit of harmonizing lets the listener down gently. ... part Freakwater, part Arcade Fire." - One Track Mind "A likeness to both Arcade Fire and The Low Anthem. "We Will All Be Changed" has gotten us excited about this new band, and we hope it does the same for you. - Reviewsic "Seryn is like the neighborhood friend that everyone is rooting for, and it's paying off. The varied and multi-layered songs from this band never get old, so this is a New Year's present in waiting." - Pegasus News "One of Denton's hottest bands in any genre." - Fort Worth Star-Telegram "Beautiful arrangements (both in instrumentation and in vocal harmonies) and an epic, "big sky" sound that, at times, seems more fitting washing over dilapidated wooden pews in an old church than the usual torn-up couches, vinyl booths and barstools of area venues." - Dallas Observer "Like ice-cold water on a hot day, their music is crisp and refreshing, and I cannot get enough. The imagery packed into their set is unreal. It’s like listening to the soundtrack of a great love story, breathtaking drama, and a dark tragedy all rolled into one over-the-top, unparalleled performance." - My Denton Music _________________________________________ Track Listing: 1. So Within 2. Of Ded Moroz 3. Beach Song 4. We Will All Be Changed 5. Towering 6. Our Love 7. River Song 8. Bete Noire 9. On My Knees 10. Untitled Follow Seryn

name: Birds & Batteries: Panorama - CD
description:
Stream Songs Here
To purchase CD, click "ADD TO CART" below Release: SP008 | 10.12.10 Status: In Stock Description: Our 6th co-release with the good people at Velvet Blue Music. This is a rare mix of organic and electronic, pop and experimental and an effortless play of surprising elements. Birds & Batteries 2009 EP "Up To No Good" showed singer / bandleader Michael Sempert exploring synth-funk and the influences of Bowie's "Scary Monsters" and P-funk. On "Panorama," his love for artists like Harry Nilsson, ELO, and David Byrne shines through, and he trades in a bit of the irony for empathy. Sempert might as well be a scientist in his next life, as he is able to blend his classic folk-ish voice with synth textures for down right futuristic results. When pressed for a simple summary, he's described the sound as "Art-rock meets Tom Petty." Basically it's not all that easy to define. The new record conjures up blue skies and big views. It is heartfelt and bold and we think you'll actually feel better for hearing it. _________________________________________ Track Listing: 1. Panorama 2. A Million People 3. Raincheck 4. Strange Kind of Mirror 5. We're An Industry 6. Another Inferno 7. The Machine & The Vampire 8. The Villain 9. Some Hypnotic Flash Follow Birds & Batteries

name: Birds & Batteries: Panorama - LP (Download Card)
description:
Stream Songs Here
To purchase LP, click "ADD TO CART" below Release: SP008 | 10.12.10 Status: In Stock! Description: Our 6th co-release with the good people at Velvet Blue Music. This is a rare mix of organic and electronic, pop and experimental and an effortless play of surprising elements. Birds & Batteries 2009 EP "Up To No Good" showed singer / bandleader Michael Sempert exploring synth-funk and the influences of Bowie's "Scary Monsters" and P-funk. On "Panorama," his love for artists like Harry Nilsson, ELO, and David Byrne shines through, and he trades in a bit of the irony for empathy. Sempert might as well be a scientist in his next life, as he is able to blend his classic folk-ish voice with synth textures for down right futuristic results. When pressed for a simple summary, he's described the sound as "Art-rock meets Tom Petty." Basically it's not all that easy to define. The new record conjures up blue skies and big views. It is heartfelt and bold and we think you'll actually feel better for hearing it. _________________________________________ Track Listing: Side A 1. Panorama 2. A Million People 3. Raincheck 4. Strange Kind of Mirror 5. We're An Industry Side B 6. Another Inferno 7. The Machine & The Vampire 8. The Villain 9. Some Hypnotic Flash Follow Birds & Batteries

name: Doug Burr: O Ye Devastator CD
description:
Stream Songs Here
To purchase CD, click "ADD TO CART" below Release: SP007 | 05.04.10 Status: In Stock! _______________________________________ Description: O Ye Devastator is co-released with our pals Velvet Blue Music in CD and Digital format. LP coming soon from XRA Records. The album was co-produced by Doug Burr and Britton Beisenherz at Ramble Creek Studios in Austin, TX. For those of you who are already fans of Mr. Burr, his new record "O Ye Devastator" is finally here. Help us celebrate its release! For those of you unfamiliar with Doug Burr, we think this will be a great treat for your ears and soul. Burr resides in the beautiful city of Denton, TX, and is by no means a stranger to making music. "O Ye Devastator" is his 3rd release with us, which is the proper follow-up to 2007's much adored, "On Promenade". Between these 2 records Burr recorded a project called "The Shawl", which was a shimmering and heavy laden vision of the Psalms. _________________________________________ Press "a stirring collection of eleven new songs dotted with slide guitar, banjo, and Burr’s spectral vocals–a surefire pleaser for fans of both the Son Volt/Jayhawks school of rootsy alt-country as well as those partial to the folksy reinventions of artists like Devendra Banhart and Mark Kozelek. " - Onetrackmind.com "Anyone who has ever heard his heartbreakingly gripping brand of folk knows the power his music can hold. His voice cuts through to the bone, serving as the centerpiece in a carefully crafted painting of a slower, more introspective time and place. " - Dallas Observer "a dusky and sweet voice somewhat similar to Ben Knox Miller of The Low Anthem and carries that same captivating quality that Ray Lamontagne has when he sings. It’s that power that makes you get lost in the music as if watching a spell-binding story unfold. There’s also an instrumental track on the album called “All Our Lives,” for some reason this reminded me of a part from the movie I’m Not There, during the funeral scene where Jim James & Calexico play “Goin’ to Acapulco.” - Randomville.com "Anyone who has spent time with Burr’s music in the past will not be surprised at what they find on O Ye Devastator. In fact, they will get exactly what they’re looking for. For the uninitiated, the album is a perfect chance to discover what the fuss is about. This album doesn’t work just as an introduction to Burr’s music, but a culmination of his work thus far. It’s Burr’s finest and most accomplished album yet, and easily one of the best of the year so far." - Pegasusnews.com "mesmerizing tracks like A Black Wave Is Comin' and High Blood and Long Evening Dresses -- sneaks up on you in dazzling fashion." - Fort Worth Star-Telegram "songs so familiar you can't believe you've never heard them before." - Dallas Observer "Exceptional Denton Troubadour" - Austinsound.net _______________________________________ Track Listing: 1. A Black Wave Is Comin' 2. Chief of Police in Chicago 3. At the Public Dance 4. Red, Red 5. You've Been a Suspect All Your Life 6. I Got This Fever / O Ye Devastator 7. Topeka 8. Do You Hear Wedding Bells 9. All Our Lives (instrumental) 10. And When We Awoke 11. High Blood and Long Evening Dresses Digital Download iTunes Amazon CD Baby Follow Doug Burr: Facebook Twitter MySpace Website

name: Telegraph Canyon: The Tide and The Current LP
description:
Stream Songs Here
To purchase LP, click "ADD TO CART" below Release: SP006 | 08.18.09 Status: In Stock! Description: It takes just the first few opening hollow piano notes of 'The Tide and The Current', produced by Will Johnson (Centro-Matic, South San Gabriel), to set in motion the idea that Telegraph Canyon is a band with purpose and craft. Tags like Southern Gothic and Dark Folk could be applied, but neither convey the earnestness, yearning, and desperation of these recordings. After a few listens, you start to feel as if the band is playing these songs just for you. This is a co-release with our friends at Velvet Blue Music. ______________________________________ Press: The Tide and The Current stands as one of the decade's without-a-doubt best - Dallas Observer
The Tide And The Current is an incredibly pleasant experience and highly recommended for fans of the dark folk genres. - Rocksellout.com
The band creates an amazing authentic sound wave that makes your eardrum beats like it probably never did before. If you like bands like Fleet Foxes, Bon Iver, The Low Anthem or My Morning Jacket, than Telegraph Canyon is major league for you. No question ask this band rocks! - Real Roots Café / Netherlands
Spaced out Americana RIYL My Morning Jacket, Centro-matic and Wilco. - One-Track-Mind.com
The Tide and the Current captures a band evolving from first track to last, stepping up and grabbing hold of what is rightfully theirs. In Telegraph Canyon’s case, that might just be the mantle of the region’s most promising act. - Fort Worth Star-Telegram
The new disc is a soul-bearing, deliberately paced, at-once epic and restrained force, beautifully arranged both in its instrumentation and in its vocal harmonies. A surefire contender for best area release of 2009, the disc more than solidifies the band's rightful place among the region's best. - Dallas Observer ______________________________________ Side A: 1. Into the Woods 2. Safe On the Outside 3. Shake Your Fist 4. Come the Morning Side B: 5. A Light in the Field 6. Welcome to the Night 7. Quiet Assurance 8. Captain 9. Dressed in Fight 10. Reels and Wires ______________________________________ Follow Telegraph Canyon: Facebook Twitter MySpace Website

name: The Shawl Performed By Doug Burr CD
description:
Stream and Share Songs Here
Click "ADD TO CART" Below Download at iTunes Release: SP005 | 12.09.08 Status: In Stock! Description: This is a new full length project from Mr. Burr. It was recorded in Tehuacana, TX at Texas Hall, an extremely worn building built in the 1860's. All the music is by Burr and Co. while the lyrics are lifted directly from the Psalms. Burr explains that these words have the universal ability to speak across generations, nationalities, and classes with authenticity and ache. This is a beautiful record, with beautiful sounds, and beautiful artwork. This is a co-release with our friends at Velvet Blue Music. ______________________________________ Press: Doug Burr delivers enough heartbreak to drive you to the edge of the bridge, and just enough hope to keep you from jumping. Rugged and pristine, this is music that gets under your skin and goes straight for the heart like a shot of morphine. - Real Roots Cafe, Holland Burr shares an intrinsic knowledge of song dynamics with the likes of Jeff Tweedy, and has a voice that tugs at the heart strings. Brilliant! - Americana UK Burr evokes distinctive voices such as Wilco's Jeff Tweedy or Red House Painters' Mark Kozelek. These warm, inviting compositions are effortlessly beautiful. - FW Star-Telegram ______________________________________ Track Listing: 1. I Am Weary With My Singing 2. God Is Known in Judah 3. Surely God is Good to Israel 4. A Thousand May Fall 5. The Righteous Will Rejoice 6. And We Will Be Saved 7. My Voice Rises to God 8. Which We Have Heard and Known 9. In the Lord I Take Refuge ______________________________________ Follow Doug Burr: Facebook Twitter MySpace Website

name: Doug Burr: On Promenade CD
description:
Stream and Share Songs Here
Click "ADD TO CART" Below Download at iTunes Release: SP004 | 10.19.07 Status: In Stock! Description: "On Promenade" is Doug Burr's second full-length release, and is eleven tracks beautifully soaked in sincerity, heartache, and love. Twinges of Wilco, Young, Oldham, and maybe some hints of Jurado, Swift, or Bazan, though Doug's music is clearly his own. Subtle yet commanding, and it actually feels meaningful. In the words of a recent bloggers...“This is an album that is bound to stand the test of time. Doug Burr is kind of a big deal." This is a co-release with our friends at Velvet Blue Music. ______________________________________ Press: Doug Burr delivers enough heartbreak to drive you to the edge of the bridge, and just enough hope to keep you from jumping. Rugged and pristine, this is music that gets under your skin and goes straight for the heart like a shot of morphine. - Real Roots Cafe, Holland Top “Four to Watch" band. Exquisitely detailed, slow and deliberate, his songs have as much in common with the literature of Eudora Welty and Cormac McCarthy as with the work of the Americana dimmerati to whom he is often, and somewhat shortsightedly, compared...- Paste Magazine Burr evokes distinctive voices such as Wilco's Jeff Tweedy or Red House Painters' Mark Kozelek. These warm, inviting compositions are effortlessly beautiful. - FW Star-Telegram Burr shares an intrinsic knowledge of song dynamics with the likes of Jeff Tweedy, and has a voice that tugs at the heart strings. Brilliant! - Americana UK “Next Big Thing”, “Best Solo Act” - Dallas Morning News QUICK Awards Channeling Tom Waits (and a little Ryan Adams), Doug Burr brings a classic sense of storytelling to his almost-gravelly songs - Lullabyes.net ______________________________________ Track Listing: 1. Slow Southern Home 2. Come To My Senses 3. Graniteville 4. Whippoorwill 5. How Can The Lark (My Dear Theo) 6. Should've Known 7. In the Garden 8. Thing About Trouble 9. Last Promenade 10. Always Travel Light 11. Blood Runs Downhill ______________________________________ Follow Doug Burr: Facebook Twitter MySpace Website

name: LaMonica: How Shall They Hear CD EP
description: Click "ADD TO CART" Below Release: SP001 | 2004 Status: Limited Stock Description: The debut release from John LaMonica (My Spacecoaster, The Polyphonic Spree) features songs so sparse and frail they can only be described as haunting. Be careful listening to this as it has been known to make those who do disappear. This is a co-release with our friends from Velvet Blue Music. ______________________________________ Track Listing: 1. Kids 2. Tiny 3. Wasting Time 4. This Quiet House 5. Will You Be Around 6. No Fault

name: Comet: Feathers From The Wing CD EP
description: Click "ADD TO CART" Below Release: SP002 | 2005 Status: Limited Stock Description: Grab what few copies are left of this release. It will probably be the last Comet material you ever hear! Once sharing a label with Spiritualized, the Cranes and Beth Orton, Comet dropped their domestic debut record Chandelier Musings in October of '96 and March '97 in the UK. However, the band came to an unexpected halt after a tour-van accident on icy roads in Minnesota left the band splintered and disillusioned after returning home. In 2005, Comet returned after 8 years of  silence with Spune releasing the highly anticipated "feathers from the wing" EP. After only a few public appearances and shows around DFW and Austin, the band found itself back in the studios consumed in the writing phase. Unfortunately, this again has lead to another unexpected hiatus. The guys are involved in their own personal journeys with their families and enjoying life. Hopefully, one day we will again be able to soak in the beautiful, dreamy, noise pop songs that we've always loved from this band! PS. Jim Stone continues to write. If we're lucky, he'll let you hear a demo or two. ______________________________________ Track Listing: 1. Miss The World 2. Feathers That Shone 3. Sputnik 4. Outward 5. Taxicab Blues 6. Have You Seen The Contrails 7. A' Chagall
